alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 6:38AM PST until March 04 at 7:45AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The Chehalis River will continue to rise today due to recent heavy rain with minor flooding forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 46.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 49.0 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 245 PM PST.
